lines.text: Don't forget old Harry. For £100, I'll let you have a quarter share of my new play.
A quarter share? I'll take half!
Spoken like a gent!
[Kipps's friends point out that they can't drink champagne in the shop]
Oh, Hang the shop!
Hang the shop?
Hang the shop, and hang old Shalford!

[appearing behind Kipps]
Kipps! That's it! Once more I said and that's it. Well, that is it. You're done for, Kipps. Finished! Sacked!

[turning to face Shalford]
Watch it, Shalford!
What?

I said, you just watch it. You can't sack me. Do you know why? I've just resigned. Right here and now, this minute, resigned. So you act civil, an... and you act respectable, or you'll find that you're the one with the sack!
[Kipps reveals his new-found fortune]

[as Shalford]
I don't like the way this place is run, so you better wake yourself up, or you'll find yourself out
[shouts]
on your ear! 'Ficiency, Shalford! 'Ficiency, System,
[Kipps places a top hat on his head]
and that to your blessed economy. And you can stick that on my account!
[Kipps has received a letter from Ann]
Who's that from? As if we didn't know!
Does that girl ever run out of ink?
No, she never lets me down!
[Kipps opens the shop doors, to find Harry standing outside]
Stay away from me. You've got me in enough trouble as it is!
Time and tide wait for no man, lend me your ears! I've just come from your solicitor.
And?
And your late grandfather...
I didn't know I had one!
You had a mother?
Margaret Euphenia!
Well, she had a father, your grandfather, and on his deathbed, he decided to recognise his illegimate grandson.
Me?
You!
How much?
A fortune, my boy!
No!
What?
A year - and your grandfather's house!
